body:
Aug 10, 2015: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton high-fives a supporter at a campaign stop in Manchester, New Hampshire. (Reuters)


Quick: Express your frustration with a complex policy problem using only goofy drawings and symbols. Because, you know, millennials. 
The Hillary Clinton campaign tried an exercise along these lines earlier this week, when it asked supporters to tweet their thoughts on student loan debt using only ‘emojis’ -- as part of Clinton's rollout of her college affordability plan. 

How does your student loan debt make you feel? Tell us in 3 emojis or less.
— Hillary Clinton (@HillaryClinton) August 12, 2015


Now, even the Clinton campaign seems to acknowledge the gimmick backfired. 
Instead of inviting a cascade of cute and clever emojis on the student debt crisis, Twitter users roundly mocked the attempt at social media engagement with young potential voters. 


"@HillaryClinton: How does your student loan debt make you feel? Tell us in 3 emojis or less." pic.twitter.com/2OG9oVtJLm
— Parker Molloy (@ParkerMolloy) August 12, 2015



@HillaryClinton can't figure out how to display "fire your social media intern" in emojis sorry HilDawg
— Leah Unchained (@little__leah) August 13, 2015



@HillaryClinton who is doing your social media strategy? �� me. pic.twitter.com/ufwZRob0Pb
— nicolette mason (@nicolettemason) August 12, 2015



@HillaryClinton No. But here's how being asked to communicate my feelings on a complex issue in emojis makes me feel: ������
— Raquel Hinson (@raquelhinson) August 13, 2015



How does @HillaryClinton make you feel? Tell her in 3 emojis or less. �������� I used 4 because I'm a Libertarian so I do what I want.
— Pepper (@WineAndLiberty) August 13, 2015



@HillaryClinton Feeling the Bern ������
— Ctrl. Alt. Design. (@Ctrl_Alt_Design) August 13, 2015



@HillaryClinton I paid mine off like a responsible adult. Is there an emoji for that?
— Ian Beyer (@ianbeyer) August 13, 2015


Others took aim at the email-related issues dogging the Clinton campaign:

Hey here's you avoiding State Dept record-keeping laws ������ @HillaryClinton
— Honkey Kong (@Bro_Pair) August 13, 2015



@HillaryClinton ����✉️ (It feels as bad as when the Feds take my personal server to investigate the Top Secret emails I criminally diverted)
— Awkward Fuzzball (@awkwardfuzzball) August 12, 2015


While others took aim at the grammatical misstep in the tweet:

I think you mean three emojis or FEWER. @HillaryClinton
— Katha Pollitt (@KathaPollitt) August 12, 2015



@HillaryClinton Or fewer, you ignorant fools.
— GrkStav (@GrkStav) August 13, 2015


Eventually, the Clinton campaign appeared to acknowledge that maybe the exercise didn't go over so well.

¯\_(ツ)_/¯ (But in all seriousness: http://t.co/A4pWb3fOf4) pic.twitter.com/qQBYSnkJZa
— Hillary Clinton (@HillaryClinton) August 12, 2015
description: A call by 2016 Democratic frontrunner Hillary Clinton for people on Twitter to tweet their thoughts on student loan debt using ‘emojis’ backfired spectacularly, with even the Clinton camp admitting it didn’t quite hit the mark.
title: Emoji OMG: Clinton's student debt Twitter push backfires
